missing_information: Total amount of cash income earned from handyman work during the year
Out-of-pocket expenses for supplies, tools, or mileage related to the side jobs
Whether any Forms 1099-NEC or other tax forms were issued for the side work
Dates and frequency of the handyman services performed
Business use percentage of any personal vehicle used for the jobs
interview_questions: Approximately how much cash did you receive from handyman jobs over the entire year?
Did any of your clients issue you a Form 1099-NEC or other tax form for those jobs?
During which months did you perform this side work, and how often each month?
What supplies, tools, or materials did you purchase specifically for these jobs, and what did they cost?
Did you track the miles driven or other vehicle expenses when traveling to and from these handyman jobs?
documentation_needed: Detailed log of handyman jobs with dates, clients, and amounts paid
Receipts for supplies, tools, and materials used in side work
Mileage log or other vehicle expense records for business travel
Any Forms 1099-NEC received for handyman income
Bank statements highlighting deposits related to the cash work

missing_information: Amount of each medical expense that was reimbursed by insurance or Medicare
Total Medicare Part B, Part D, or supplemental insurance premiums paid in the year
Any pre-tax medical premiums withheld from paychecks
Details of any HSA or FSA contributions or distributions
Out-of-pocket costs for medical travel or long-term care premiums, if any
interview_questions: How much of the $7,200 in medical bills was reimbursed by your insurance or Medicare?
What were your total Medicare Part B and Part D premiums for the year?
Were any of your medical premiums paid with pre-tax dollars through your employer?
Did you contribute to, or take distributions from, an HSA or FSA in 2023?
Did you have any mileage, lodging, or other travel costs related to medical care that were not reimbursed?
documentation_needed: Year-end Explanation of Benefits (EOB) showing reimbursements
Form SSA-1099 or other statements showing Medicare premiums
Year-end paystub or W-2 Box 12 codes for pre-tax medical deductions
Forms 1099-SA and 5498-SA for any HSA activity
Itemized receipts for all unreimbursed medical expenses

missing_information: Tyler’s total gross income and whether he will file his own return
Number of months Tyler lived in the client’s home versus a dorm or elsewhere
Whether Tyler was enrolled as a full-time student for at least five months
Total financial support provided by Robert compared to support from Tyler or others
Existence of any custody agreement granting dependency rights to the other parent
interview_questions: How many months did Tyler live overnight in your home during the tax year?
Was Tyler enrolled as a full-time student for at least five months of 2023?
Did Tyler earn any income in 2023, and will he file his own tax return?
Roughly how much did you spend on Tyler’s support, and did he pay any of his own expenses?
Is there a divorce decree or custody agreement that addresses who may claim Tyler as a dependent?
documentation_needed: Form 1098-T and tuition billing statements from State University
Enrollment verification letter showing Tyler’s full-time student status
Tyler’s W-2s, 1099s, or copy of his tax return (if filed)
Custody or divorce decree outlining dependency rights
Proof of Tyler’s residency at Robert’s address (e.g., mail, driver’s license, dorm contract)

missing_information: Square footage of the home office and of the entire home
Confirmation that the office space is used exclusively and regularly for work
Any employer reimbursement or allowance for home-office expenses
Number of days worked outside the home office (e.g., coffee shops)
Whether the client has any self-employment income that also uses the office
interview_questions: What is the square footage of your dedicated office space and of your whole home?
Is the spare-bedroom office used exclusively and regularly for your employer’s work?
Did your employer reimburse or provide an allowance for any home-office costs?
On approximately how many days did you work from locations other than your home office last year?
Do you have any freelance or self-employment activity that also uses this office space?
documentation_needed: Written employer policy or email showing remote-work requirement
Monthly utility bills for the full tax year
Mortgage interest statements or annual rent ledger
Floor plan or measurements showing office and total home square footage
Receipts for desk, chair, monitor, and other office equipment

missing_information: Written acknowledgments with tax IDs for each cash donation of $250 or more
Fair-market value and original cost basis of each item of furniture donated
Any mileage or out-of-pocket expenses incurred for charitable volunteer work
Whether the taxpayers will itemize deductions or take the standard deduction
Confirmation that no goods or services were received in exchange for the donations
interview_questions: Do you have written acknowledgments with the charity’s tax ID for each donation of $250 or more?
How did you arrive at the $2,000 fair-market value for the furniture donated to Goodwill?
Did you incur any mileage or other expenses while performing volunteer work for these charities?
Were any of your donations made through payroll deduction or a donor-advised fund?
Do you plan to itemize deductions this year, or will you take the standard deduction?
documentation_needed: Official receipts or acknowledgment letters for each cash donation
Goodwill valuation guide or qualified appraisal for donated furniture
Photographs or detailed list of each donated household item with original cost
Bank or credit card statements showing monetary contributions
Mileage log or receipts for out-of-pocket charitable expenses
